intro: Joosia antioquiana, commonly known as the Antioquian joosia, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane regions. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
